Package com.twl.xg.controller

Class PageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twl.xg.controller.PageController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/page")
public class PageController
extends java.lang.Object
    This controller maps specific URL patterns to internal jsp view name, provides web page contents to users' browser.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Xiaozheng Guo

    • Method Detail

      • errorPage

        @RequestMapping("/errorPage")
public java.lang.String errorPage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                  @RequestParam(value="stackTrace",required=false)
                                  java.lang.String stackTrace)
        This is the general error page of the application. This function also takes an optional parameter "stackTrace", which is the stack trace of the error.
        Returns:
        error page view

      • dataTypeSettingPage

        @RequestMapping("/dataTypeSettingPage")
public java.lang.String dataTypeSettingPage​(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This is the first setting page
        Returns:
        The view name

      • setBorderRouterPage

        @RequestMapping("/setBorderRouterPage")
public java.lang.String setBorderRouterPage​()
        Send border router setting view to browser. If dataTypeList has not been setup yet, redirect to dataTypeSettingPage.
        Returns:
        The view name

      • setSensorNamePage

        @RequestMapping("/setSensorNamePage")
public java.lang.String setSensorNamePage​()
        Send set_sensor_name view to browser. If dataTypeList has not been initialized, redirect to dataTypeSettingPage. Else if there is no border router in database, redirect to setBorderRouterPage.
        Returns:
        set sensor name view.

      • monitorDataPage

        @RequestMapping("/monitorDataPage")
public java.lang.String monitorDataPage​()
        Send monitor_data view to browser. If dataTypeList has not been initialized, redirect to dataTypeSettingPage. Else if there is no border router in database, redirect to setBorderRouterPage. Sensor name doesn't actually matter, because if the user has not set sensor name, the default name will be the sensor's IP.
        Returns:
        monitor data view name.
